lines.text: When you married me you knew that I couldn't cook, I couldn't sew, and I couldn't keep house. All I could do was talk Hungarian and do imitations of Zsa Zsa Gabor.
Who?
But he couldn't be dead.
Oh, yes he could, I personally attended his funeral.
Are you sure?
I don't know what you do in New York, but around here we don't give a man a funeral unless we're pretty sure he needs one.

[after watching a "conversation" between Lisa and an oinking Arnold]
How can you carry on a conversation with him? I can't understand a thing he's saying!
That's because you don't LISTEN!
Call the sheriff.
OK. Sheriff.
No. On the phone.

[trying to hawk some worthless ceramic figurines off and claiming they're valuable]
These are gen-yew-wine Siamese Catfish.
SIAMESE CATFISH?
Well, they're still in the pussy stage.

[after learning Oliver and Lisa are going to be out of town for a few days]
While yer away on yer trip, I thought you might like to avail yerself of Haney's Farm Mindin' Service.
HANEY'S FARM MINDING SERVICE?
Yessir, at Haney's Farm Mindin' Service, for a nom-yew-nal fee we will move into yer house, eat yer food, drink yer likker, and turn away any unwanted relatives that might show up at yer door.
Sure, I remember that kid, he had on the most realistic looking pig costume I've ever seen. He won first prize!
No, you don't understand, Arnold is a REAL PIG!
I'll say he is! We had five gallons of ice cream for those kids, and he ate every bit of it himself!
Hello, Mrs Douglas! How are you?
Hello, Mr. Kimball. I'm fine. Well, I'm not really fine. I have a little headache. Well, it isn't a little headache, it's a... it went away!
I know somebody that talks just like that. Well, not just like that. What was his name? Oh yes, it was... no, it wasn't him...
Why do you want to irritate your corn?
Irrigate. It means put water on it.
Won't that irritate it?
You mallet head!
How 'bout a dehydrated chicken?
A dehydrated chicken?
Yeah. Just add water and bones, and let it sit for a couple hours, and you might have your own reconstituted chicken.
That's the most ridiculous thing I ever heard.
[the Douglases are looking for clothes to donate to a rummage sale]
Why don't we give away this one?
No that's the dress I graduated from high school in.
How about this one?
That's the dress I wore the first day of college.

[holding a black, low-cut dress]
What about this one?
That's the one I got expelled in.
Could you keep it a secret from my husband? You see, I want to surprise him.
My lips are sealed.
Now if we could only keep them that way.
If you weren't so sexy, I'd beat your brains out!

[as he and Mr. Ziffel are going into Oliver's house]
Make sure you wipe yer feet.
You don't ever wipe YOUR feet!
That's 'cause I don't own a pig farm.
